about-me-text:
I am a first-year student at IG2I - Centrale Lille, specializing in computer science and industrial engineering.

Passionate about programming and computing, my goal is to become a software engineer.

Outside of classes, I spend a lot of time coding.

I have created various games, scripts, and tools to automate daily tasks, such as file backups or quiz generation to test my knowledge.
project-text-procedural-world:
Creating infinite worlds in a fully procedural and automated way using the Unity game engine.
See the project
project-text-mobile-game:
A wide variety of video games, all coded with Unity, ranging from 2D to 3D, including multiplayer implementation, each offering a unique experience and representing a technical challenge.
See the projects
project-text-automatisation:
Programs and scripts to automate certain tasks like file backups and homework collection.
Also, the creation of a NAS.
See the project
project-text-numworks:
I coded several games for the Numworks calculator to learn Python and create games without any external help (graphics engine, pre-made physics, etc.).
See the project
project-text-ascii-maze:
A project to create a mini maze game that runs in the console using only ASCII characters.
See the project
project-text-board-game:
Inventing a board game and its rules based on strategy and logical thinking to win.
See the project
more-on-me-text:
I started as a self-taught developer, learning the languages I deemed necessary to bring my projects to life (websites, games, automation, etc.), including C#, Python, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. However, I believe that learning never stops. I am constantly continuing to learn new languages to explore new possibilities.

In addition to acquiring these languages, I have also learned to master essential development tools such as Git, GitHub, Unity, and Visual Studio Code.

What truly drives me are challenges, whether in programming or in sports.

I practiced Viet Vo Dao for 5 years and club paddle for 3 years (which I continue during the summer). These experiences taught me discipline and perseverance.

In programming, this taste for challenge translates into the pleasure of coding a program under a tight deadline, quickly learning a new language, or solving complex problems on websites like LeetCode.

I also enjoy the logic and strategy of chess. In summary, no matter the field, I always seek to satisfy my curiosity and turn complex problems into concrete solutions.
